intro: Castilleja macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and relies on a host plant for some of its nutrients. The plant produces bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are typically hairy as well. Castilleja macrocarpa is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
